content:
ActiveDirectorySite Class

In this Article

The ActiveDirectorySite class defines a set of domain controllers that are well-connected in terms of speed and cost. A site object consists of a set of one or more IP subnets.

Syntax

Declaration

public class ActiveDirectorySite : IDisposable

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • ActiveDirectorySite

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)

Constructors summary

ActiveDirectorySite(DirectoryContext,String)

Initializes a new instance of the ActiveDirectorySite class, using the specified DirectoryContext object.

Properties summary

AdjacentSites

Gets a read-only collection of sites that are connected through a common site link with this site object.
BridgeheadServers

Gets a read-only collection of bridgehead servers for this site.
Domains

Gets all domains in the site.
InterSiteTopologyGenerator

Gets or sets the directory server that serves as the inter-site topology generator.
IntraSiteReplicationSchedule

Gets or sets the default setting for the replication schedule for the site.
Location

Gets or sets the location of the site.
Name

Gets the name of the site.
Options

Gets or sets the site options.
PreferredRpcBridgeheadServers

Returns a collection of directory servers that are designated as preferred bridgehead servers for the RPC transport.
PreferredSmtpBridgeheadServers

Returns a collection of directory servers that are designated as preferred bridgehead servers for the SMTP transport.
Servers

Returns a read-only collection of directory servers in the site.
SiteLinks

Gets a read-only collection of site links that involve this site.
Subnets

Returns a writable collection of subnets in the site.

Methods summary

Delete()

Deletes the current site.
Dispose()

Releases all resources used by the object.
Dispose(Boolean)

Releases the unmanaged resources used by the object and optionally releases the managed resources.
FindByName(DirectoryContext,String)

Returns a site based on a site name.
GetComputerSite()

Gets the site that this computer is a member of.
GetDirectoryEntry()

Gets the DirectoryEntry object for this site.
Save()

Writes any changes to the object to the Active Directory Domain Services store.
ToString()

Returns the name of the site.

Constructors

  • ActiveDirectorySite(DirectoryContext,String)

    Initializes a new instance of the ActiveDirectorySite class, using the specified DirectoryContext object.

    public ActiveDirectorySite (System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryContext context, string siteName);

    Parameters

    • context
      DirectoryContext

      A DirectoryContext object for creating this site.

    • siteName
      String

      The name for the new site.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

    • ActiveDirectoryServerDownException

      The target server is either busy or unavailable.

    • ArgumentException

      This exception will occur for any one of the following reasons:

      • The target in the context parameter is not a forest, configuration set, domain controller, or an AD LDS server.

      • siteName is an empty string.

    • ArgumentNullException

      context or siteName is null.

    • AuthenticationException

      The credentials that were supplied are not valid.

Properties

  • AdjacentSites

    Gets a read-only collection of sites that are connected through a common site link with this site object.

    public System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReadOnlySiteCollection AdjacentSites { get; }

    Property Value

    • ReadOnlySiteCollection

      A ReadOnlySiteCollection collection that contains a read-only collection of sites that are connected through a common site link with this site.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

    • ActiveDirectoryServerDownException

      The target server is either busy or unavailable.

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object has been disposed.

  • BridgeheadServers

    Gets a read-only collection of bridgehead servers for this site.

    public System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReadOnlyDirectoryServerCollection BridgeheadServers { get; }

    Property Value

    • ReadOnlyDirectoryServerCollection

      A ReadOnlyDirectoryServerCollection collection that contains a read-only collection of directory servers in this site.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

    • ActiveDirectoryServerDownException

      The target server is either busy or unavailable.

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object has been disposed.

  • Domains

    Gets all domains in the site.

    public System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DomainCollection Domains { get; }

    Property Value

    • DomainCollection

      A DomainCollection object containing all domains in the site.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

    • ActiveDirectoryServerDownException

      The target server is either busy or unavailable.

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object has been disposed.

  • InterSiteTopologyGenerator

    Gets or sets the directory server that serves as the inter-site topology generator.

    public System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryServer InterSiteTopologyGenerator { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • DirectoryServer

      A read/write DirectoryServer object that represents the directory server that serves as the inter-site topology generator.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

    • ActiveDirectoryServerDownException

      The target server is either busy or unavailable.

    • NotSupportedException

      The transport type is not supported.

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object has been disposed.

    Remarks

    To ensure that the modification of an inter-site connection object is not overwritten by the Knowledge Consistency Checker (KCC), you must make the modification on the computer that has the ISTG (Inter-Site Topology Generator) role in the site of the modified connection object.

  • IntraSiteReplicationSchedule

    Gets or sets the default setting for the replication schedule for the site.

    public System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectorySchedule IntraSiteReplicationSchedule { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ActiveDirectorySchedule

      A read/write ActiveDirectorySchedule that represents the default setting for the replication schedule for the site.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object has been disposed.

  • Location

    Gets or sets the location of the site.

    public string Location { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A string value that gets or sets the location of the site.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object has been disposed.

  • Name

    Gets the name of the site.

    public string Name { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A string value that contains the name of the site.

    Exceptions

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object has been disposed.

  • Options

    Gets or sets the site options.

    public System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectorySiteOptions Options { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ActiveDirectorySiteOptions

      A read/write ActiveDirectorySiteOptions value that gets or sets the site options.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object has been disposed.

  • PreferredRpcBridgeheadServers

    Returns a collection of directory servers that are designated as preferred bridgehead servers for the RPC transport.

    public System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryServerCollection PreferredRpcBridgeheadServers { get; }

    Property Value

    • DirectoryServerCollection

      A DirectoryServerCollection object that contains the directory servers that are designated as preferred bridgehead servers for the RPC transport.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

    • ActiveDirectoryServerDownException

      The target server is either busy or unavailable.

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object has been disposed.

  • PreferredSmtpBridgeheadServers

    Returns a collection of directory servers that are designated as preferred bridgehead servers for the SMTP transport.

    public System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryServerCollection PreferredSmtpBridgeheadServers { get; }

    Property Value

    • DirectoryServerCollection

      A DirectoryServerCollection object that contains a collection of directory servers that are designated as preferred bridgehead servers for the SMTP transport.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

    • ActiveDirectoryServerDownException

      The target server is either busy or unavailable.

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object has been disposed.

  • Servers

    Returns a read-only collection of directory servers in the site.

    public System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReadOnlyDirectoryServerCollection Servers { get; }

    Property Value

    • ReadOnlyDirectoryServerCollection

      A ReadOnlyDirectoryServerCollection that contains a read-only collection of directory servers in the site.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

    • ActiveDirectoryServerDownException

      The target server is either busy or unavailable.

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object has been disposed.

  • SiteLinks

    Gets a read-only collection of site links that involve this site.

    public System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReadOnlySiteLinkCollection SiteLinks { get; }

    Property Value

    • ReadOnlySiteLinkCollection

      A ReadOnlySiteLinkCollection object that contains a read-only collection of site links that this site is in.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

    • ActiveDirectoryServerDownException

      The target server is either busy or unavailable.

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object has been disposed.

  • Subnets

    Returns a writable collection of subnets in the site.

    public System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectorySubnetCollection Subnets { get; }

    Property Value

    • ActiveDirectorySubnetCollection

      An ActiveDirectorySubnetCollection object that contains a writable collection of subnets in the site.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

    • ActiveDirectoryServerDownException

      The target server is either busy or unavailable.

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object has been disposed.

    Remarks

    The ActiveDirectorySubnetCollection object is writable. After modification, the Save method should be called.

Methods

  • Delete()

    Deletes the current site.

    public void Delete ();

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

    • ActiveDirectoryServerDownException

      The target server is either busy or unavailable.

    • InvalidOperationException

      The ActiveDirectorySite object has not yet been saved in the Active Directory Domain Services store.

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object has been disposed.

    • UnauthorizedAccessException

      The specified account does not have permission to perform this operation.

  • Dispose()

    Releases all resources used by the object.

    public void Dispose ();
  • Dispose(Boolean)

    Releases the unmanaged resources used by the object and optionally releases the managed resources.

    protected virtual void Dispose (bool disposing);

    Parameters

    • disposing
      Boolean

      true if the managed resources should be released; false if only the unmanaged resources should be released.

  • FindByName(DirectoryContext,String)

    Returns a site based on a site name.

    public static System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectorySite FindByName (System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryContext context, string siteName);

    Parameters

    • context
      DirectoryContext

      An DirectoryContext object that is valid for this site.

    • siteName
      String

      The name of the site to find.

    Returns

    • ActiveDirectorySite

      An ActiveDirectorySite object for the requested site.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryObjectNotFoundException

      The site could not be found for the given siteName in the context specified.

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

    • ActiveDirectoryServerDownException

      The target server is either busy or unavailable.

    • ArgumentException

      This exception will occur for any one of the following reasons:

      • The target in the context parameter is not a forest, configuration set, domain controller, or an AD LDS server.

      • siteName is an empty string.

    • ArgumentNullException

      context or siteName is null.

    • AuthenticationException

      The credentials that were supplied are not valid.

  • GetComputerSite()

    Gets the site that this computer is a member of.

    public static System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectorySite GetComputerSite ();

    Returns

    • ActiveDirectorySite

      An ActiveDirectorySite object that contains the caller's current site.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryObjectNotFoundException

      The caller's computer does not belong to a site.

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

    • ActiveDirectoryServerDownException

      The target server is either busy or unavailable.

  • GetDirectoryEntry()

    Gets the DirectoryEntry object for this site.

    public System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntry GetDirectoryEntry ();

    Returns

    • DirectoryEntry

      The DirectoryEntry object for this site.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The ActiveDirectorySite object has not yet been saved in the Active Directory Domain Services store.

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object has been disposed.

  • Save()

    Writes any changes to the object to the Active Directory Domain Services store.

    public void Save ();

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryObjectExistsException

      The site object already exists.

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

    • ActiveDirectoryServerDownException

      The target server is either busy or unavailable.

    • NotSupportedException

      The transport type is not supported.

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object has been disposed.

    • UnauthorizedAccessException

      The specified account does not have permission to perform this operation.

  • ToString()

    Returns the name of the site.

    public override string ToString ();

    Returns

    • String

      A String that represents the name of the site.

    Exceptions

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object has been disposed.

rawMetadata.description: The ActiveDirectorySite class defines a set of domain controllers that are well-connected in terms of speed and cost. A site object consists of a set of one or more IP subnets.
